column5: these are from years gone by, i know there are big ones still there ! caught different years, all on the same boat, 1st. my biggest,2nd-friend,3rd-nephew,4th-nephew ! 2nd pic 54 & 33lbs.----4th pic 53 & 34lbs.
Once or twice...Going Sat for first time this year!

great fish-- i live in london, an hour & 45 mins. away, great musky factory as long as the Asian Carp don't get into St. Clair ? you should have great weather for saturday, been no storms, so shouldn't have weed problems, go get em !
Miss that Handlebarz guy ?
All nice fish.  Have to get down there someday.
Ahhh, the good old days before the locked elbow pose!  Great pics man!  Edit..  Not sure what spell check was doing on that one....
Muhahhhaaa.Where you been man, new lady friend? That will keep you busy. There aren't any Musky left on LSC, zero, zip, ziltch. Don't bother going.
I still lurk a lot.  But I have a new job, and I can't be on here all day at work like I used to be?

I can't believe how many here post all day when they are supposed to be working (Terry, Brian). Ah man I digressed once again after saying I wouldn't just the other day to Art. I have deleted 95% of the post.

Nowhere as often as ManitouBass2. MB2, come in please, MB2 come in please, over. I found out through another member here he is OK then he texted me. He's fine. I was on a few other sites regularly and haven't posted there in years. I only got kicked off of 1, actually I kicked the proprietor out not he me.
I like to hold the smaller ones out sometimes for effect!

I get out there a couple times a year....but figure people get bored of pictures of 36 inch muskies that seem to grace my boat out there! You got some real beauties though. I did go around a month ago. Fished around 6 hours and my buddy was bored so we left. Just a dirty pike for our efforts. That's a looong drive from Guelph for 6 hours fishing and one jack to show for it.
Its an even longer drive from St. Catharines!
We put an offer on a place 15 minutes from Lake St. Clair. They wouldn't budge so no sale. I might never be home but I would only be 15 minutes from the shack.
What happened?

All great looking fish there. St. Clair appears to be a very healthy musky factory so I hope it gets looked after. I know those musky have lots of 5 lb smallies to eat!! Lol Seriously considering making a move to a Ranger walleye boat...620 or 621. St. Clair musky would follow shortly afterwards. ?
Your a bass guy aren’t you?  Do it do it do it do it ??
I don't care how big or small a fish is, it's a fish. A goby after 5 hours of hitting the water hurts though, I don't count them as a fish.
In years gone by he was a frequent contributor here with lots of St.Clair musky pics, guess not enough time like Solopaddler. He is still around  https://www.handlebarzfishing.com/
Oh!!!! I was one more do it away from pulling the trigger!!! Lol ?
